member.name: T:GroupDocs.Viewer.Legacy.Converter.Options.CadOptions
member.summary: The CAD documents rendering options.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Viewer.Legacy.Converter.Options.CadOptions.ScaleFactor
member.summary: The scale factor affects the size of an output document.
member.remarks: Values higher than 1 will enlarge and values between 0 and 1 will make render result smaller. This property is ignored when either Height or Width properties are set.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Viewer.Legacy.Converter.Options.CadOptions.Width
member.summary: The width of the render result in pixels.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Viewer.Legacy.Converter.Options.CadOptions.Height
member.summary: The height of the render result in pixels.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Viewer.Legacy.Converter.Options.CadOptions.RenderLayouts
member.summary: Indicates whether layouts from CAD document should be rendered. Default value is false.
member.remarks: This option applies only to CAD formats, that support layouts, like dxf and dwg. When render layouts is enabled, Model and all non-empty layouts contained in the CAD document will be rendered. Otherwise only Model is rendered.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Viewer.Legacy.Converter.Options.CadOptions.LayoutName
member.summary: The name of the specific layout to render.
member.remarks: This property is case-insensitive.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Viewer.Legacy.Converter.Options.CadOptions.Layers
member.summary: The list of document layers to render.
member.remarks: When the list is empty, all visible layers will be rendered. Layer names are case sensitive.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Viewer.Legacy.Converter.Options.CadOptions.Tiles
member.summary: The coordinates of the drawing regions, that should be rendered.
member.remarks: Please note, that this option works only for DWG format. When the list is empty, then whole drawing is rendered. When the list contains at least one tile, then ScaleFactor, Width, Height, RenderLayouts and LayoutName properties are ignored.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Viewer.Legacy.Converter.Options.CellsOptions
member.summary: The Spreadsheet documents rendering options.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Viewer.Legacy.Converter.Options.CellsOptions.ShowGridLines
member.summary: Indicates whether to show grid lines in converted document. The default value is false.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Viewer.Legacy.Converter.Options.CellsOptions.OnePagePerSheet
member.summary: Specifies worksheet rendering mode. Default value is true.
member.remarks: When one page per sheet rendering is enabled, all worksheet content is rendered into a single page. Otherwise worksheet content is divided into pages, where each page includes count of rows defined in count rows per page option.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Viewer.Legacy.Converter.Options.CellsOptions.IgnoreEmptyRows
member.summary: Indicates whether empty rows should be ignored. The default value is false.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Viewer.Legacy.Converter.Options.CellsOptions.IgnoreEmptyColumns
member.summary: Indicates whether empty columns should be ignored. The default value is false.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Viewer.Legacy.Converter.Options.CellsOptions.Encoding
member.summary: The text (*.csv) document encoding.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Viewer.Legacy.Converter.Options.CellsOptions.InternalHyperlinkPrefix
member.summary: Prefix for hyperlink that references worksheet inside the same document.
member.remarks: Excel workbook may contain hyperlink to specific location in the same workbook. Internal hyperlink prefix is useful for applications where workbook sheets are rendered separately one by one. In this case internal hyperlink may contain some REST API method address with referenced sheet name. Value may contain page number placeholder which will be substituted with referenced sheet number.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Viewer.Legacy.Converter.Options.CellsOptions.CountRowsPerPage
member.summary: The number of rows rendered into one page when one page per sheet rendering mode is not enabled. Default value is 50.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Viewer.Legacy.Converter.Options.CellsOptions.TextOverflowMode
member.summary: Text overflow mode applied when the text is too big to fit into the cell. Default value is TextOverflowMode.OverlayIfNextIsEmpty.
member.remarks: Text overflow mode is only applicable for rendering into HTML.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Viewer.Legacy.Converter.Options.PdfOptions
member.summary: The PDF documents rendering options.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Viewer.Legacy.Converter.Options.PdfOptions.EnablePreciseRendering
member.summary: Indicates whether the PDF document is rendered in a precise mode or not. The default value is false.
member.remarks: The precise rendering mode allows to keep maximum precision during positioning of glyphs on the page. When this option is enabled, it will degrade performance, but in certain cases will improve render result.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Viewer.Legacy.Converter.Options.PdfOptions.UseOriginalContentOrdering
member.summary: Specifies content ordering mode when rendering into HTML. The default value is false.
member.remarks: When original content ordering is enabled, text and graphics are rendered into HTML according to z-order in original PDF document. This mode is preferable for rendering PDF documents with multi-layered layout. When original content ordering is not enabled text and graphics are rendered into HTML as a single layer.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Viewer.Legacy.Converter.Options.PdfOptions.RenderLayersSeparately
member.summary: Specifies whether PDF document layers have to be separated when rendering into HTML. The default value is false.
member.remarks: When rendering layered PDF documents into HTML, by default all layers are rendered as one. Enable layers separate rendering in order to group each PDF layer into separate elements, so that layers can be manipulated using Javascript.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Viewer.Legacy.Converter.Options.PdfOptions.ImageQuality
member.summary: Specifies output image quality for image resources when rendering as HTML. The default value is Low.
member.remarks: When rendering PDF documents which contains images it is possible to set desired image quality.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Viewer.Legacy.Converter.Options.PdfOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Viewer.Legacy.Converter.Options.HtmlOptions
member.summary: Provides options for rendering document into HTML format.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Viewer.Legacy.Converter.Options.HtmlOptions.EmbedResources
member.summary: Indicates whether to embed resources into HTML or not.
member.remarks: To save resources (fonts, images and CSS) into a separate file, enable the use of cache and disable resource embedding as shown in example.
member.value: true if this instance is resources embedded; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Viewer.Legacy.Converter.Options.HtmlOptions.HtmlResourcePrefix
member.summary: Specifies prefix for HTML resources.
member.remarks: Resource prefix may be useful when resources for document are obtained via some REST API method. Supported replacement patterns: {page-number}, {resource-name}.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Viewer.Legacy.Converter.Options.HtmlOptions.IgnorePrefixInResources
member.summary: Indicates whether to ignore resource prefix for nested resources. Nested resource is a resource that resides inside another resource.
member.remarks: Resource prefixes when set by option, not only apply to the references of HTML resources, but also apply to the references inside resources that themselves contain other resources (e.g. CSS that link to external fonts or SVG images that links to other resources). In order to prevent adding prefixes inside resource documents set this option true.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Viewer.Legacy.Converter.Options.HtmlOptions.EnableResponsiveRendering
member.summary: Indicates whether rendering will provide responsive web pages, that look well on different device types. Default value is false.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Viewer.Legacy.Converter.Options.HtmlOptions.EnableMinification
member.summary: Indicates whether output content (HTML, SVG and CSS) should be minified. Default value is false.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Viewer.Legacy.Converter.Options.HtmlOptions.ExcludeFonts
member.summary: Indicates whether to include fonts into HTML. Default value is false.
member.remarks: When fonts are included, depending on option, they will be embedded inline as base64-encoded fonts or added as separate resources.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Viewer.Legacy.Converter.Options.HtmlOptions.ExcludeFontsList
member.summary: The list of font names, that will be excluded from HTML.
member.remarks: The fonts that are added into HTML, improve stability of the output view, at the same time increase the size the rendering result. This option, lets you find compromise, between stability and output size. Include the font names that are popular and exist in most systems. Please note, this property is active only when ExcludeFonts property is set to false.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: The custom font directories paths

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Viewer.Legacy.Config.ViewerConfig.StoragePath
member.summary: The path to the documents storage directory.
member.remarks: Storage path acts as a base location in the file system, for the documents rendering. When the full path to the document is not provided, API assumes that the document is located in the storage directory. By default, cache files are stored in the folder, inside the storage directory.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Viewer.Legacy.Config.ViewerConfig.CacheFolderName
member.summary: The name of the folder inside the storage path that will be used for storing cache files.
member.remarks: This property is ignored when CachePath property is set.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Viewer.Legacy.Config.ViewerConfig.CachePath
member.summary: The path to the directory, where the cache will be stored.
member.remarks: When the cache path is set, the cache folder name will be ignored.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Viewer.Legacy.Config.ViewerConfig.EnableCaching
member.summary: Indicates whether to cache rendering results or not.
member.remarks: Enabling cache will let to avoid processing the same document more than once.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Viewer.Legacy.Config.ViewerConfig.ForcePasswordValidation
member.summary: Indicates whether to force password validation for protected documents. By default is false.
member.remarks: When the password protected document is rendered with the caching enabled, the password is not validated on subsequent calls. Set this option true, when you need to force checking password each time the document is rendered. Please note, that the password validation increases rendering time.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Viewer.Legacy.Config.ViewerConfig.PageNamePrefix
member.summary: The prefix for generated page name. Default is "page".
member.remarks: The page name prefix is used for naming files in the cache. It should not contain invalid characters, that are not allowed for file names.

member.remarks: Default font name may be specified in following cases: - You want to generally specify the default font to fall back on, if particular font in the document cannot be found during rendering. - Your document uses fonts, that contain non-English characters and you want to make sure any missing font is replaced with one that has the same character set available.

member.summary: Provides options for rendering documents into HTML format.

member.summary: Enables responsive rendering; Responsive web-pages render well on a devices with different screen size.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Viewer.Options.HtmlViewOptions.Minify
member.summary: Enables HTML content and HTML resources minification.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Viewer.Options.HtmlViewOptions.ExcludeFonts
member.summary: When enabled prevents adding any fonts into HTML document.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Viewer.Options.HtmlViewOptions.FontsToExclude
member.summary: The list of font names, to exclude from HTML document.
member.remarks: This option is supported for presentations only. The fonts that are added into HTML document improve stability of the output view, at the same time they increase the size of the rendering result. This option, lets you find compromise, between stability and output size. Include the font names that are popular and installed into most systems. Please note, this property is active only when options is disabled.

member.remarks: This option is supported when rendering into PNG or JPG formats.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Viewer.NamespaceDoc
member.summary:
The GroupDocs.Viewer namespace provides classes for rendering documents in HTML5, Image or PDF modes fast and with high quality.
The main classes in this namespace are:
is the entry point for rendering process.
provides an easy way to customize caching, loging behaviour etc.
represents all supported file types.
member.remarks: The central class of this namespace is . This class incorporates a set of settings to control document rendering process.
